info.title: Dub.co API
info.description: Dub is link management infrastructure for companies to create marketing campaigns, link sharing features, and referral programs.

post.description: Create a new link for the authenticated workspace.

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace.

schema.description: The ID of the workspace.

parameters.name: projectSlug
parameters.description: The slug of the project. This field is deprecated – use `workspaceId` instead.

schema.description: The slug of the project. This field is deprecated – use `workspaceId` instead.

url.description: The destination URL of the short link.

domain.description: The domain of the short link. If not provided, the primary domain for the workspace will be used (or `dub.sh` if the workspace has no domains).

key.description: The short link slug. If not provided, a random 7-character slug will be generated.

externalId.description: This is the ID of the link in your database. If set, it can be used to identify the link in the future. Must be prefixed with `ext_` when passed as a query parameter.

prefix.description: The prefix of the short link slug for randomly-generated keys (e.g. if prefix is `/c/`, generated keys will be in the `/c/:key` format). Will be ignored if `key` is provided.

archived.description: Whether the short link is archived.

publicStats.description: Whether the short link's stats are publicly accessible.

tagId.description: The unique ID of the tag assigned to the short link. This field is deprecated – use `tagIds` instead.

tagIds.description: The unique IDs of the tags assigned to the short link.

tagNames.description: The unique name of the tags assigned to the short link (case insensitive).

comments.description: The comments for the short link.

expiresAt.description: The date and time when the short link will expire at.

expiredUrl.description: The URL to redirect to when the short link has expired.

password.description: The password required to access the destination URL of the short link.

proxy.description: Whether the short link uses Custom Social Media Cards feature.

title.description: The title of the short link generated via `api.dub.co/metatags`. Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

description.description: The description of the short link generated via `api.dub.co/metatags`. Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

image.description: The image of the short link generated via `api.dub.co/metatags`. Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

rewrite.description: Whether the short link uses link cloaking.

ios.description: The iOS destination URL for the short link for iOS device targeting.

android.description: The Android destination URL for the short link for Android device targeting.

geo.description: Geo targeting information for the short link in JSON format `{[COUNTRY]: https://example.com }`.

get.description: Retrieve a list of links for the authenticated workspace. The list will be paginated and the provided query parameters allow filtering the returned links.

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace.

schema.description: The ID of the workspace.

parameters.name: projectSlug
parameters.description: The slug of the project. This field is deprecated – use `workspaceId` instead.

schema.description: The slug of the project. This field is deprecated – use `workspaceId` instead.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The domain to filter the links by. E.g. `ac.me`. If not provided, all links for the workspace will be returned.

schema.description: The domain to filter the links by. E.g. `ac.me`. If not provided, all links for the workspace will be returned.

parameters.name: tagId
parameters.description: The tag ID to filter the links by. This field is deprecated – use `tagIds` instead.

schema.description: The tag ID to filter the links by. This field is deprecated – use `tagIds` instead.

parameters.name: tagIds
parameters.description: The tag IDs to filter the links by.

schema.description: The tag IDs to filter the links by.

parameters.name: tagNames
parameters.description: The unique name of the tags assigned to the short link (case insensitive).

schema.description: The unique name of the tags assigned to the short link (case insensitive).

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: The search term to filter the links by. The search term will be matched against the short link slug and the destination url.

schema.description: The search term to filter the links by. The search term will be matched against the short link slug and the destination url.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user ID to filter the links by.

schema.description: The user ID to filter the links by.

parameters.name: showArchived
parameters.description: Whether to include archived links in the response. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

schema.description: Whether to include archived links in the response. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

parameters.name: withTags
parameters.description: Whether to include tags in the response. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

schema.description: Whether to include tags in the response. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field to sort the links by. The default is `createdAt`, and sort order is always descending.

schema.description: The field to sort the links by. The default is `createdAt`, and sort order is always descending.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number for pagination (each page contains 100 links).

schema.description: The page number for pagination (each page contains 100 links).

get.description: Retrieve the number of links for the authenticated workspace. The provided query parameters allow filtering the returned links.

schema.description: The ID of the workspace.

parameters.name: projectSlug
parameters.description: The slug of the project. This field is deprecated – use `workspaceId` instead.

parameters.description: The domain to filter the links by. E.g. `ac.me`. If not provided, all links for the workspace will be returned.

schema.description: The domain to filter the links by. E.g. `ac.me`. If not provided, all links for the workspace will be returned.

parameters.name: tagId
parameters.description: The tag ID to filter the links by. This field is deprecated – use `tagIds` instead.

schema.description: The tag ID to filter the links by. This field is deprecated – use `tagIds` instead.

parameters.description: The tag IDs to filter the links by.

schema.description: The tag IDs to filter the links by.

parameters.name: tagNames
parameters.description: The unique name of the tags assigned to the short link (case insensitive).

schema.description: The unique name of the tags assigned to the short link (case insensitive).

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: The search term to filter the links by. The search term will be matched against the short link slug and the destination url.

schema.description: The search term to filter the links by. The search term will be matched against the short link slug and the destination url.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user ID to filter the links by.

schema.description: The user ID to filter the links by.

parameters.name: showArchived
parameters.description: Whether to include archived links in the response. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

schema.description: Whether to include archived links in the response. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

parameters.name: withTags
parameters.description: Whether to include tags in the response. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

schema.description: Whether to include tags in the response. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

parameters.name: groupBy
parameters.description: The field to group the links by.

schema.description: The field to group the links by.
The number of links matching the query.

get.description: Retrieve the info for a link.

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace.

schema.description: The ID of the workspace.

parameters.name: projectSlug
parameters.description: The slug of the project. This field is deprecated – use `workspaceId` instead.

schema.description: The slug of the project. This field is deprecated – use `workspaceId` instead.
The domain of the link to retrieve. E.g. for `d.to/github`, the domain is `d.to`.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the link to retrieve. E.g. for `d.to/github`, the key is `github`.

schema.description: The key of the link to retrieve. E.g. for `d.to/github`, the key is `github`.

parameters.name: linkId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the short link.

schema.description: The unique ID of the short link.

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: This is the ID of the link in the your database. Must be prefixed with `ext_` when passed as a query parameter.

schema.description: This is the ID of the link in the your database. Must be prefixed with `ext_` when passed as a query parameter.

patch.description: Update a link for the authenticated workspace.

parameters.name: linkId
parameters.description: The id of the link to update. You may use either `linkId` (obtained via `/links/info` endpoint) or `externalId` prefixed with `ext_`.

schema.description: The id of the link to update. You may use either `linkId` (obtained via `/links/info` endpoint) or `externalId` prefixed with `ext_`.

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace.

schema.description: The ID of the workspace.

parameters.name: projectSlug
parameters.description: The slug of the project. This field is deprecated – use `workspaceId` instead.

schema.description: The slug of the project. This field is deprecated – use `workspaceId` instead.

domain.description: The domain of the short link. If not provided, the primary domain for the workspace will be used (or `dub.sh` if the workspace has no domains).

key.description: The short link slug. If not provided, a random 7-character slug will be generated.

externalId.description: This is the ID of the link in your database. If set, it can be used to identify the link in the future. Must be prefixed with `ext_` when passed as a query parameter.

prefix.description: The prefix of the short link slug for randomly-generated keys (e.g. if prefix is `/c/`, generated keys will be in the `/c/:key` format). Will be ignored if `key` is provided.

archived.description: Whether the short link is archived.

publicStats.description: Whether the short link's stats are publicly accessible.

tagId.description: The unique ID of the tag assigned to the short link. This field is deprecated – use `tagIds` instead.

comments.description: The comments for the short link.

expiredUrl.description: The URL to redirect to when the short link has expired.

password.description: The password required to access the destination URL of the short link.

proxy.description: Whether the short link uses Custom Social Media Cards feature.

title.description: The title of the short link generated via `api.dub.co/metatags`. Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

description.description: The description of the short link generated via `api.dub.co/metatags`. Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

image.description: The image of the short link generated via `api.dub.co/metatags`. Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

rewrite.description: Whether the short link uses link cloaking.

android.description: The Android destination URL for the short link for Android device targeting.

delete.description: Delete a link for the authenticated workspace.

parameters.name: linkId
parameters.description: The id of the link to delete. You may use either `linkId` (obtained via `/links/info` endpoint) or `externalId` prefixed with `ext_`.

schema.description: The id of the link to delete. You may use either `linkId` (obtained via `/links/info` endpoint) or `externalId` prefixed with `ext_`.

get.description: Retrieve a QR code for a link.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to generate a QR code for. Defaults to `https://dub.co` if not provided.

schema.description: The URL to generate a QR code for. Defaults to `https://dub.co` if not provided.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the QR code in pixels. Defaults to `600` if not provided.

schema.description: The size of the QR code in pixels. Defaults to `600` if not provided.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The level of error correction to use for the QR code. Defaults to `L` if not provided.

schema.description: The level of error correction to use for the QR code. Defaults to `L` if not provided.

parameters.name: fgColor
parameters.description: The foreground color of the QR code in hex format. Defaults to `#000000` if not provided.

schema.description: The foreground color of the QR code in hex format. Defaults to `#000000` if not provided.

parameters.name: bgColor
parameters.description: The background color of the QR code in hex format. Defaults to `#ffffff` if not provided.

schema.description: The background color of the QR code in hex format. Defaults to `#ffffff` if not provided.

parameters.name: includeMargin
parameters.description: Whether to include a margin around the QR code. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

schema.description: Whether to include a margin around the QR code. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

get.description: Retrieve the number of clicks for a link, a domain, or the authenticated workspace.

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace.

schema.description: The ID of the workspace.

parameters.name: projectSlug
parameters.description: The slug of the project. This field is deprecated – use `workspaceId` instead.

schema.description: The slug of the project. This field is deprecated – use `workspaceId` instead.

parameters.name: groupBy
parameters.description: The field to group the analytics by. If undefined, returns the total click count.

schema.description: The field to group the analytics by. If undefined, returns the total click count.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The domain to filter analytics for.

schema.description: The domain to filter analytics for.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The short link slug.

schema.description: The short link slug.

parameters.name: linkId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the short link on Dub.

schema.description: The unique ID of the short link on Dub.

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: This is the ID of the link in the your database. Must be prefixed with 'ext_' when passed as a query parameter.

schema.description: This is the ID of the link in the your database. Must be prefixed with 'ext_' when passed as a query parameter.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The interval to retrieve analytics for. Takes precedence over start and end.

schema.description: The interval to retrieve analytics for. Takes precedence over start and end.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The start date and time when to retrieve analytics from.

schema.description: The start date and time when to retrieve analytics from.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The end date and time when to retrieve analytics from. If not provided, defaults to the current date.

schema.description: The end date and time when to retrieve analytics from. If not provided, defaults to the current date.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The country to retrieve analytics for.

schema.description: The country to retrieve analytics for.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The city to retrieve analytics for.

schema.description: The city to retrieve analytics for.

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: The device to retrieve analytics for.

schema.description: The device to retrieve analytics for.

parameters.name: browser
parameters.description: The browser to retrieve analytics for.

schema.description: The browser to retrieve analytics for.

parameters.name: os
parameters.description: The OS to retrieve analytics for.

schema.description: The OS to retrieve analytics for.

parameters.name: referer
parameters.description: The referer to retrieve analytics for.

schema.description: The referer to retrieve analytics for.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to retrieve analytics for.

schema.description: The URL to retrieve analytics for.

parameters.name: tagId
parameters.description: The tag ID to retrieve analytics for.

schema.description: The tag ID to retrieve analytics for.

parameters.name: qr
parameters.description: Filter for QR code scans. If true, filter for QR codes only. If false, filter for links only. If undefined, return both.

schema.description: Filter for QR code scans. If true, filter for QR codes only. If false, filter for links only. If undefined, return both.

parameters.name: root
parameters.description: Filter for root domains. If true, filter for domains only. If false, filter for links only. If undefined, return both.

schema.description: Filter for root domains. If true, filter for domains only. If false, filter for links only. If undefined, return both.

start.description: The starting timestamp of the interval

clicks.description: The number of clicks in the interval
The number of clicks from this country

country.description: The 2-letter country code of the city: https://d.to/geo

clicks.description: The number of clicks from this city
The number of clicks from this device
The number of clicks from this browser
The number of clicks from this OS

referer.description: The name of the referer. If unknown, this will be `(direct)`

clicks.description: The number of clicks from this referer

link.description: The unique ID of the short link

clicks.description: The number of clicks from this link
The number of clicks from this URL

get.summary: Retrieve the metatags for a URL
get.description: Retrieve the metatags for a URL.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to retrieve metatags for.

schema.description: The URL to retrieve metatags for.

title.description: The meta title tag for the URL.
title.example: Dub.co - Link Management for Modern Marketing Teams

description.description: The meta description tag for the URL.
description.example: Dub.co is the open-source link management infrastructure ...

image.description: The OpenGraph image for the URL.

id.description: The unique ID of the short link.

domain.description: The domain of the short link. If not provided, the primary domain for the workspace will be used (or `dub.sh` if the workspace has no domains).

key.description: The short link slug. If not provided, a random 7-character slug will be generated.

externalId.description: This is the ID of the link in your database. If set, it can be used to identify the link in the future. Must be prefixed with 'ext_' when passed as a query parameter.

url.description: The destination URL of the short link.

archived.description: Whether the short link is archived.

expiresAt.description: The date and time when the short link will expire in ISO-8601 format.

expiredUrl.description: The URL to redirect to when the short link has expired.

password.description: The password required to access the destination URL of the short link.

proxy.description: Whether the short link uses Custom Social Media Cards feature.

title.description: The title of the short link generated via `api.dub.co/metatags`. Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

description.description: The description of the short link generated via `api.dub.co/metatags`. Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

image.description: The image of the short link generated via `api.dub.co/metatags`. Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

rewrite.description: Whether the short link uses link cloaking.

ios.description: The iOS destination URL for the short link for iOS device targeting.

android.description: The Android destination URL for the short link for Android device targeting.

geo.description: Geo targeting information for the short link in JSON format `{[COUNTRY]: https://example.com }`. Learn more: https://d.to/geo

publicStats.description: Whether the short link's stats are publicly accessible.

tagId.description: The unique ID of the tag assigned to the short link. This field is deprecated – use `tags` instead.

tags.description: The tags assigned to the short link.

comments.description: The comments for the short link.

shortLink.description: The full URL of the short link, including the https protocol (e.g. `https://dub.sh/try`).

qrCode.description: The full URL of the QR code for the short link (e.g. `https://api.dub.co/qr?url=https://dub.sh/try`).

utm_source.description: The UTM source of the short link.

utm_medium.description: The UTM medium of the short link.

utm_campaign.description: The UTM campaign of the short link.

utm_term.description: The UTM term of the short link.

utm_content.description: The UTM content of the short link.

userId.description: The user ID of the creator of the short link.

workspaceId.description: The workspace ID of the short link.

clicks.description: The number of clicks on the short link.

lastClicked.description: The date and time when the short link was last clicked.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the short link was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the short link was last updated.

projectId.description: The project ID of the short link. This field is deprecated – use `workspaceId` instead.

id.description: The unique ID of the workspace.

usageLimit.description: The usage limit of the workspace.

linksUsage.description: The links usage of the workspace.

linksLimit.description: The links limit of the workspace.

domainsLimit.description: The domains limit of the workspace.

tagsLimit.description: The tags limit of the workspace.

usersLimit.description: The users limit of the workspace.

stripeId.description: The Stripe ID of the workspace.

billingCycleStart.description: The date and time when the billing cycle starts for the workspace.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the workspace was created.

role.description: The role of the authenticated user in the workspace.

users.description: The role of the authenticated user in the workspace.

primary.description: Whether the domain is the primary domain for the workspace.

inviteCode.description: The invite code of the workspace.

id.description: The unique ID of the tag.
The unique identifier of the domain.

primary.description: Whether the domain is the primary domain for the workspace.

placeholder.description: Provide context to your teammates in the link creation modal by showing them an example of a link to be shortened.

expiredUrl.description: The URL to redirect to when a link under this domain has expired.

target.description: The page your users will get redirected to when they visit your domain.

type.description: The type of redirect to use for this domain.

clicks.description: The number of clicks on the domain.

400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

doc_url.description: A link to our documentation with more details about this error code

401.description: Although the HTTP standard specifies "unauthorized", semantically this response means "unauthenticated". That is, the client must authenticate itself to get the requested response.

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

doc_url.description: A link to our documentation with more details about this error code

403.description: The client does not have access rights to the content; that is, it is unauthorized, so the server is refusing to give the requested resource. Unlike 401 Unauthorized, the client's identity is known to the server.

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

doc_url.description: A link to our documentation with more details about this error code

404.description: The server cannot find the requested resource.

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

doc_url.description: A link to our documentation with more details about this error code

409.description: This response is sent when a request conflicts with the current state of the server.

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

doc_url.description: A link to our documentation with more details about this error code

410.description: This response is sent when the requested content has been permanently deleted from server, with no forwarding address.

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

doc_url.description: A link to our documentation with more details about this error code

422.description: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

doc_url.description: A link to our documentation with more details about this error code

429.description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time ("rate limiting")

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.
